interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2013/12/26
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'Français (Canada)', 'हिन्दी', 'Español (España)', 'मराठी', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Português', 'తెలుగు', 'Français (France)', 'தமிழ்'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Français', 'Indonesia', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Nederlands', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', 'Tiếng Việt', '中文（简体）'], 'Directors': ['Robert Schwentke'], 'Producers': ['Lorenzo di Bonaventura', 'Mark Vahradian'], 'Starring': ['Julian McMahon', 'James Remar', 'Ernest Borgnine'], 'Studio': ['Lionsgate']}
Review Text: I really liked this movie, liked all of the actors - casting was spot on. It's a little bit romantic comedy, a little bit action/adventure, and a little bit conspiracy spy thriller - a little something for everybody. Don't take it too seriously and you'll enjoy it. Be aware that there's lots of violence, but it's light-hearted violence, no blood and guts. It's worth watching!
Review Title: A light-hearted CIA spy thriller
Rating: 4.0
--------------------------------------------------
